headline.print_headline: In Switch, City Says It Can Speed Up Replacing School Lights Containing PCBs
headline.seo: New York City Now Says It Can Speed Up Replacing School Lights Containing PCBs
headline.main: In Switch, City Says It Can Speed Up Replacing School Lights Containing PCBs

docs.abstract: Bloomberg administration faces pressure to speed up its process for replacing light fixtures in New York City schools containing cancer-causing chemicals known as PCBs; city officials release statement saying that job could be completed before previously announced timetable of 2021.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bloomberg administration had previously said that it needed 10 years to complete the job.
docs.snippet: The Bloomberg administration had previously said that it needed 10 years to complete the job.
